c74object.name: dot.urn
c74object.description: Outputs random numbers and keeps track of each number that has been generated. When all numbers up to the maximum (set via an argument or the right inlet) have been output, a bang is send out the right outlet.

inlet.digest: add numbers back to the pot

outlet.digest: Bang if the pot is empty (all numbers have been chosen).

objarg.name: limit
objarg.description: The number of possible values for the random number generator. If no argument is typed in, there will be only 1 possible number.

objarg.name: seed
objarg.description: A second argument is used to set a "seed" value for the random generator. If no argument is specified, the time value will be used to initialize the seed.

method.name: bang
method.description: In left inlet: Sends out a previously unchosen random number from 0 to one less than the specified maximum limit.

method.name: max
method.description: Clears the list of already chosen numbers, and specifies the number of possible values for the random number generator. The random numbers will range from 0 to one less than this maximum limit.

method.name: in1
method.description: Put numbers back into the pot.

method.name: clear
method.digest: Clear the list of output numbers
method.description: In left inlet: Clears the list of already chosen numbers.

method.name: seed
method.description: In left inlet: The word seed, followed by a number, provides a "seed" value for the random generator, which causes a specific (reproducible) sequence of pseudo-random numbers to occur. The number 0 uses the time elapsed since system startup (an unpredictable value) as the seed, ensuring an unpredictable sequence of numbers. This unpredictable seed is used by default when the urn object is created. However, once all numbers have been chosen, the sequence will repeat. Therefore, in order to achieve a non-repeating sequence of numbers, you will need to send the urn object the seed 0 message each time you send it the clear message.
